Have any of you ever withdrew from both benzos and opiates before? I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.

My doctor even says that I was stabilized far too high at detox (which is rare from what I hear) and I'm on a taper plan where I drop 2mg per week down to 8 (currently on 10, dropping to 8 tomorrow), and 2mg every 2 weeks after that until I'm down to 2, which I'll probably stay on for a while just as a safety net as I finish getting my life together.

okay so here's the story, i'm on suboxone, but a very very small dose, .5mg or less daily as i'm just about finished coming off of it. i stopped taking it for a day and a half because i hurt my knee at work, and over the weekend i've probably taken about 80mg-120mg of oxycodone and the withdrawal symptoms i get when i wake up in the morning are a bit worse than i'd have from the suboxone, but still not really anything that bad.
Decided to start kind of small tonight and only ate 1 of the morphines.  They are the ABG 200 ones. 2 of the opanas.
I had a few adderall so I mixed a little powder of that with the opana powder to reduce gelling.
So I have a decent tolerance, can take 200mg of "op" oxys and be cool.
Update to the best opiates in the worst form post... (Cross-section of the Exalgo and the powder for the dremeled Opana)
Just looking for advice on what she should say... She's going for headaches which she does have. Massive migraines. But also has an unhealed broken ankle.
Now I think these would be great taper devices as the dose is so low.

sometimes i just miss partying and getting high.

even in recovery you are so energetic and kind of perma-tweeked
I have been using for the past 4 months, 4-5 bags a day.

All these horror stories about Sub w/d is making me concerned, but I figure I havent taken enough or long enough to get any serious w/d from the Sub, I think I will just take some Melatonin and Clonidine tonight and hope for the best! I have work and school tomorrow then I have the entire 3 day weekend to wither away, I have a feeling the worst is yet to come.

my gp gave me gabapentin to help withdrawl three weeks ago and last night i flushed then down the toilet because I caught myself abusing them.

I'd love to build a network of sober friends who are battling or have defeated an addiction to pain pills.

The only thing I take now is my prescription Zoloft which I've been on 10 years.
I was already hooked on benzos back in 2015 so that isnt an option for me.
I suffered for years quitting and relapsing, and im finally feeling like myself again. I spend most of my days with a smile on my face now.
I've been up all night because of stupid adderal,
Does anyone have real bad pain with their withdrawal? I wake up in severe pain if I haven't used within 12 hours. How long does this last?
How much and what mg and how many hours in between can I dose this stuff to keep withdrawals bearable for a cold turkey from H?

I've been prescribed benzos for 7 years and they are afraid to take me or they won't take me until I'm detoxed off of them but I'm sorry just one does not come off of benzos everyday for 7 years in 5 days while trying to detox off of heroin, it's a recipe for death

I am going to try and switch to suboxone once again and I do not want to go into PDWs. Sometimes I can't wait and it's either take the sub or do heroin, if I do the suboxone and go into percip what can I do instead of using?

I got inducted on 8 mg of suboxone today and I went into percip withdrawal nothing crazy just some RLS and anxiety and all that moderate WD. So I instantly panicked and called my dealer and had me a bag ready for when I left because I'm court ordered I couldn't just leave.

Also I have been on Valium for 7 years and also a horrible drug to come off of since it's such long lasting like suboxone. Would the same concept work if I switched to xanax a faster acting benzo for a couple of months and went to detox and got it over with in a couple of weeks instead of years.
I finally got off of dope using a sub taper. Coming up on 6 months clean from heroin/fent.
I took 2mg sub this morning at 9am. If I took the norcos tomorrow morning/ afternoon will It work?
I have been off opiates for 3 years now thanks to kratom & a shit-load of willpower.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA.
I celebrated when I found a fentanyl patch in my room at two-ish months clean and was able to throw that shit in the trash.
I can't imagine being out in the rain or snow and experiencing withdrawal, praying that someone will come through or that you can scrounge up enough money to pick up and not be sick.
I have 16 months clean as of Monday, and I'm going in for oral surgery tomorrow because the worst of my many bad teeth has been keeping me awake for days.

I did some oxy a day ago before I knew about the test and I wanna know if I'm gonna be tested for it. Oxy won't trip the opiate test because its not a morphine derivative but will it trip that last one??
I ask this because my tolerance is getting up there. At around a half gram to get where I want.
are there any interviews or documentaries or **anything** at all where the user is a functional iv user nd not someone whose homeless and really too far gone?
I used to get off to this subreddit but it just makes me nervous. I guess thats the meaning of "being done."

Getting sober was the hardest thing I've ever gone through in my life... With that said I just found out one of my closest friends might have a problem with opiates and that in conjunction with another close friend who I know is going through it all is just breaking my heart.
I have Gabapentin. This is the last time I will go through this.
That I could just use 'sometimes'. That I was so much better-cleaning the house, having the energy to be a good mom, a loving partner, comfortable, happy... Why even stop?
I didn't relapse, just seemed to go away after a few days and come back wtf
I am so grateful that I have no desire to use. I'm finally over the worst of WD and my life is so much better.
I've been clean for a few months.
But I will not! No fuckin' way!!!

I've been clean over a month now but when I went to rehab everyone there told me that they could get high in their dreams and that it was weird that I couldn't. I even met a girl in a NA meeting that told me that she could get super high in her dreams and even feel the needle.
Our main message is that it's possible to be young and clean, and still enjoy life to the fullest!!
One of our writers, Johnny, just got a whole year clean and wrote about his experience.
Meditation is a tool that my friends and I have found to be super helpful in staying clean.
We believe that Star Wars is actually super deep, and wrote up this piece on how the Last Jedi relates to being clean and sober.
A lot of us who get clean and sober have this common experience of finding out who we really are as people.
What life is like at 7 months clean and sober.
My friend Chad used to do a lot of wild stuff in his addiction, but he's been clean for about a year now and wrote about how he's overcome his fears while in recovery.
They're both young and have multiple years clean and sober.
Check out this article by my friend Aly about what her journey has been like for the past 4 years!
The concept of loving yourself is super important when getting clean.
I've been clean and sober for over 4 years.
five and a half months ain't goin' out like that.
I spent six months in the rooms of Narcotics Anonymous, repeatedly using because I was under the impression that I had the power to come back and to not use no matter what.
You don't EVER have to get fucked up again. You can get to a place where you won't care to.
I have been able to do so much since I've gotten sober from IV heroin and everything else. I have traveled to five continents this past year.
